anvil.api.Config

Class ConfigOption

  • java.lang.Object
    • anvil.api.Config.ConfigOption
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable

    public class ConfigOption
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable
    Represents an option inside a ConfigFile.

    Each ConfigFile object should contain multiple ConfigOption objects, each of which need to be constructed. Constructing a ConfigOption object only needs a title and a currentValue, but every other value should be specified to fully take advantage of the class.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Garrett Stonis
    See Also:
    ConfigFile

    • Constructor Detail

      • ConfigOption

        public ConfigOption(java.lang.String title,
                    java.lang.String currentValue)
        Constructs a ConfigOption object with the given Strings.

        By default, this option accepts any response, is not required, has no default value, and has no comment.

        Parameters:
        title - String object containing the title of the option. This is checked using String.equals() at runtime. Cannot be null or empty.
        currentValue - String object containing the currentValue of the option. Null or empty if it is empty.
        See Also:
        ConfigOption(String, String, String, boolean, String, String)

      • ConfigOption

        public ConfigOption(java.lang.String title,
                    java.lang.String currentValue,
                    java.lang.String acceptedResponse,
                    boolean required,
                    java.lang.String defaultValue,
                    java.lang.String comment)
        Constructs a ConfigOption object with the given Strings and boolean.
        Parameters:
        title - String object containing the title of the option. This is checked using String.equals() at runtime. Cannot be null or empty.
        currentValue - String object containing the currentValue of the option. Null or empty if it is empty.
        acceptedResponse - String object containing the accepted responses for the option. This is checked using regex patterns at runtime. Null or empty for any value allowed.
        required - Boolean representing whether or not this option is required to be filled. If true, the default value can still be null or empty.
        defaultValue - String object containing the defaultValue of the option. Null or empty for no default value.
        comment - String object containing the comment to put in front of the option in the file. Null or empty for no comment. Can fully handle white-space characters.
        See Also:
        ConfigOption(String, String)

      • setCurrentValue

        public boolean setCurrentValue(java.lang.String currentValue)
        Sets the currentValue of the option to the given new currentValue. This must match the regex pattern stored in the acceptResponse field, or it will fail.

        NOTE: This will change the value the ConfigFile saves, so be wary.

        Parameters:
        currentValue - String object containing the value of the new currentValue.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the set was successful. False if containing the DELIMITER, empty/null and is required, or if it doesn't match the acceptedResponse.

      • getDelimiter

        public static char getDelimiter()
        Gets the delimiter of all options.
        Returns:
        Character representing the delimiter of all options.
